column4: i have a wired connection with ubuntu 10.4 and i cant get my wireless internet to work...someone told me how to fix it the other day sorry i kkeep bothering you guys....i updated somehting in the command line
and then i went to drivers and they were there
iwconfig
I was just trying to jog your memory, but try: sudo iwlist <interface-name-here> scanning
Does that work for you?
What is the interface name?  (You should have seen it in the output of iwconfig)
Do you see the network-manager anywhere on the screen?
Open a terminal window and type:  iwconfig
Do  you see the interface name there?
Tell us what the interface name is.
Yes.
Now do this: sudo iwlist wlan0 scanning
er... did the output of iwlist show an essid name?
iwconfig
er... did the output of iwconfig show an essid name?
what did it say when you gave the command: sudo iwlist wlan0 scanning
did it say that wlan0 does not support scanning?  Or what?
Ok, what is the essid of your Wireless router?
iwconfig wlan0 essid linksys  #Where linksys is the essid of your wireless router.
What is the essid of your Wireless router?
What kind of router is it?  Linksys or Dlink or...?
netgear? or...?
sudo apt-get install networkmanager
